Auth Server Design

From Peragro Tempus Wiki

The Auth Server handles user and game server authentication. It serves as single entry point for the player which provides them with a list of servers.

Requirements

User Account Management
The Auth Server shall maintain a list of user account, their passwords and whether the account is banned or not.
Game Server Management
The Auth Server shall maintain a list of registered game servers.
Each game server will be provided with a unique id. This id is used by the server together with a password to login to the auth server every time the server is started.
User Groups
The Auth Server manages basic groups of users which can be used by game server operators to give user rights. Every user can create a group and invite other users to join it. An example for a group could be "peragro developers".
Authorisation
The Auth Server will handle the authorisation only for the data stored in the auth server, not for game servers.
Permissions will be used for user group management, user account management, game server account management and auth server management.
Game joining
The Auth Server will authenticate the user and the game server won't ever know about the user password. So the auth server has to tell the game server which user wants to join and provide a way for the game server to authenticate the user.
Game server status tracking
The game server has to provide the auth server with meta data like connecting and disconnecting users, total allowed player count and if the user has to be in a certain user group to join the server.
Server statistics
The Auth Server provides statistical information about itself and the registered game servers. That may include current, average and max user online per server and over all.

Open Questions

Multiple Auth Servers

Will it be possble to have multiple auth servers and will they trust each other?

Example:

  • Auth Server 1: 1.peragro.org
  • Auth Server 2: 2.peragro.org
  • Auth Server 3: peragro.someguild.net

Accounts could be synchronized between 1.peragro.org and 2.peragro.org because they trust each other and if one fails then user could still use the other.

The peragro.someguild.net is not being trusted by the other two servers and hence they won't share their users.

A game server might register with the peragro.org auth servers and the someguild.net auth server.

If user pk@1.peragro.org connects to the game server and a user pk@peragro.someguild.net then both are online on the same game server. Since in the game, both have their characters and user name are probably not visible, both can play without knowing that they don't come from the same auth server.

Should one server cease to exist, like peragro.someguild.net. Then those characters are inaccessable on the game server. Should 1.peragro.org cease to exist, then people can still login from 2.peragro.org

Use Cases

Game server Actions
  • Game Server login
User Actions
  • Client Login
  • Show game server list
  • Show statistics
  • Joining a game
Game Management Actions
  • Registring a server
  • Deleting a game server account
User Management Actions
  • Registring a user
  • Deleting a user account
User Group Actions
  • Creating a user group
  • Joining a user group
  • Leaving a user group
  • Deleting a user group
